Member Function Documentation

const MediaFrameworkCaps* MediaFrameworkCaps::GetCapabilities (   )  const
 

Returns the MediaFramework capablities.

Returns:
A pointer to a class containing the framework capabilities; In case of failure a NULL pointer.

MediaInfo::MediaCodec MediaFrameworkCaps::GetDecoderCodec (  INT  index  )  const
 

This method returns the codec (for decoding) corresponding to the index.

Parameters:
index The index of the info object. Valid values are between 0 and GetSupportedMediaDecCodecsCount()-1.
Returns:
The MediaInfo::MediaCodec; In case the index parameter is not valid MediaInfo::UnknownCodec shall be returned.

MediaInfo::MediaCodec MediaFrameworkCaps::GetEncoderCodec (  INT  index  )  const
 

This method returns the codec (for encoding) corresponding to the index.

Parameters:
index The index of the info object. Valid values are between 0 and GetSupportedMediaEncCodecsCount()-1.
Returns:
The MediaInfo::MediaCodec; In case the index parameter is not valid MediaInfo::UnknownCodec shall be returned.

INT MediaFrameworkCaps::GetSupportedDecoderCodecsCount (   )  const
 

This method returns the total number of supported audio/video codecs (for decoding).

Returns:
The number of supported codecs.

INT MediaFrameworkCaps::GetSupportedEncoderCodecsCount (   )  const
 

This method returns the total number of supported audio/video codecs for encoding.

Returns:
The number of supported codecs.

BOOLEAN MediaFrameworkCaps::IsDecoderCodecSupported (  MediaInfo::MediaCodec  codec  )  const
 

This method provides an information if a specific audio/video codec (for decoding) is supported by the framework.

Parameters:
codec The framework will verify if the codec passed by this parameter is supported by it.
Returns:
TRUE if the codec is supported by the framework; FALSE otherwise

BOOLEAN MediaFrameworkCaps::IsEncoderCodecSupported (  MediaInfo::MediaCodec  codec  )  const
 

This method provides an information if a specific audio/video codec (for encoding) is supported by the framework.

Parameters:
codec The framework will verify if the codec passed by this parameter is supported by it.
Returns:
TRUE if the codec is supported by the framework; FALSE otherwise
